channel.title: Hyperion II - Dialogue API
channel.description:
I've been working on a Dialogue API for my Hyperion-based server, and here is the result of about 20 hours of work: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dx9kS2zSq4E]YouTube - Hyperion II Dialogue API[/url]
The code for the dialogue used in that video (for reference to the ease and efficiency of my API): [url=http://pastebin.com/xcmdvbEh][Java] - Pastebin.com[/url]

item.title: Hyperion II - Dialogue API
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Updated the API a little lot to allow for it to be written like this:

Dialogue hansTalkFive = new NPCDialogue(0, 592, "Hans", "You are in Lumbridge!","The best town in the WHOLE of Gleilnor!"); Dialogue hansTalkFour = new ChoiceDialogue("Where am I?","Nothing",hansTalkFive,null); Dialogue hansTalkThree = new NPCDialogue(0, 591, hansTalkFour, "Hans", "I am Hans, the best","servant in the land!","What can I do for you?"); Dialogue hansTalkTwo = new PlayerDialogue(591, hansTalkThree, "Who are you?!"); Dialogue hansTalkOne = new NPCDialogue(0, 591, hansTalkTwo, "Hans", "Hello there!");

A lot cleaner I’m sure you’ll agree (except it has to be written from the bottom up o.o)

Read full topic

Zuppers, I have rewritten it and will post the code as soon as I get home.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion II - Dialogue API
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

Dialogue hansTalkOne = new Dialogue(), hansTalkTwo = new Dialogue(), hansTalkThree = new Dialogue(), hansTalkFour = new Dialogue(), hansTalkFive = new Dialogue(), hansTalkSix = new Dialogue(), hansTalkSeven = new Dialogue(); hansTalkFive.NPCTalk(0, 591, "Hans", "You are in Lumbridge."); hansTalkOne.NPCTalk(0, 591, "Hans", "Hello there."); hansTalkTwo.playerTalk(615, player.getName(), "Who are you?"); hansTalkThree.NPCTalk(0, 591, "Hans", "I am Hans, and I am servant of", "the Duke of Lumbridge!"); hansTalkFour.choice("What is your name?", "Where am I?"); hansTalkSix.NPCTalk(0, 591, "Hans", "My name is Hans."); hansTalkSeven.playerTalk(615, player.getName(), "Ah, ok, I am "+player.getName()); hansTalkFour.setChoices(hansTalkSix, hansTalkFive); hansTalkOne.setNextDialogue(hansTalkTwo); hansTalkTwo.setNextDialogue(hansTalkThree); hansTalkThree.setNextDialogue(hansTalkFour); hansTalkSix.setNextDialogue(hansTalkSeven); player.getActionSender().sendDialogue(hansTalkOne);
This isn't even close to an actual API. Try using a interface or implementing a scripting language to handle things like this.
xxxxxx 13:

i think she is saying that your method for the strings has a similar/identical structure?

God why do I even bother.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion II - Dialogue API
item.dc:creator: @Aeronity Aeronity
item.description:
@Aeronity wrote:

Why not just do something like load it from a XML database and store it in a array? Much simpler than making a new instance for every single dialogue lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion II - Dialogue API
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Thanks for the feedback everyone!

glestrts:

This looks pretty nice. Your making a shitload of objects, but as long as you have a decent garbage system, it will be fine.

The objects are not used (take up no memory) until needed.

Read full topic
